NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
Extension 0..1Support for dicovery of OAuth2 endpoints
extension 1..1ExtensionUri indicating the OAuth2 "authorize" endpoint for this FHIR server.
url 1..1uri"authorize"
valueUri 0..1uri
extension 0..1ExtensionUri indicating the OAuth2 "token" endpoint for this FHIR server. Required unless the implicit grant flow is used.
url 1..1uri"token"
valueUri 0..1uri
extension 0..1ExtensionUri indicating the OAuth2 dynamic registration endpoint for this FHIR server, if supported.
url 1..1uri"register"
valueUri 0..1uri
extension 0..1ExtensionUri indicating the user-facing authorization management workflow entry point for this FHIR server. Overview in this presentation
url 1..1uri"manage"
valueUri 0..1uri
extension 0..1ExtensionUri indicating the introspection endpoint that can be used to validate a token.
url 1..1uri"introspect"
valueUri 0..1uri
extension 0..1ExtensionUri indicating the endpoint that can be used to revoke a token.
url 1..1uri"revoke"
valueUri 0..1uri
url 1..1uri"http://hl7.org/fhir/smart-app-launch/StructureDefinition/extension-oauth-uris"
value[x] 0..0

Documentation for this format

name: Support for dicovery of OAuth2 endpoints
publisher: Boston's Children Hospital and Hl7 International
description: Declares support for automated dicovery of OAuth2 endpoints If a server requires SMART on FHIR authorization for access. Any time a client sees this extension, itmust be prepared to authorize using SMART's OAuth2-based protocol.

element.name: oauth-uris
element.short: Support for dicovery of OAuth2 endpoints
element.definition: Declares support for automated dicovery of OAuth2 endpoints If a server requires SMART on FHIR authorization for access. Any time a client sees this extension, itmust be prepared to authorize using SMART's OAuth2-based protocol.

element.name: Extension.id
element.short: xml:id (or equivalent in JSON)
element.definition: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references).

element.name: Extension.extension
element.short: Extension
element.definition: An Extension

element.name: authorize
element.short: Uri indicating the OAuth2 "authorize" endpoint for this FHIR server.
element.definition: valueUri indicating the OAuth2 "authorize" endpoint for this FHIR server.

element.name: Extension.extension:authorize.id
element.short: xml:id (or equivalent in JSON)
element.definition: unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references).

element.name: Extension.extension:authorize.extension
element.short: Additional Content defined by implementations
element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comments: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

element.name: Extension.extension:authorize.url
element.short: identifies the meaning of the extension
element.definition: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.
element.comments: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition should be version specific.  This will ideally be the URI for the Resource Profile defining the extension, with the code for the extension after a #.

element.name: Extension.extension:authorize.valueUri
element.short: Value of extension
element.definition: Value of extension - may be a resource or one of a constrained set of the data types (see Extensibility in the spec for list).

element.name: token
element.short: Uri indicating the OAuth2 "token" endpoint for this FHIR server.  Required unless the implicit grant flow is used.
